file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 28-21-12-04 - MOTIVE-FLOW CHECK VALVE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL MOTIVE-FLOW CHECK VALVE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the motive-flow check valve. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ACFT WITH WET MOTIVE-FLOW CHECK VALVE - REMOV- 28-21-12-000-801-A WINGSTUB AL ACFT WITH WET MOTIVE-FLOW CHECK VALVE - INSTAL- 28-21-12-400-801-A WINGSTUB LATION ACFT WITH DRY MOTIVE-FLOW CHECK VALVE - REMOV- 28-21-12-000-802-A WINGSTUB AL ACFT WITH DRY MOTIVE-FLOW CHECK VALVE - INSTAL- 28-21-12-400-802-A WINGSTUB LATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 28-21-12 Page 1 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 28-21-12-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT WITH WET WINGSTUB 2. MOTIVE-FLOW CHECK VALVE - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task is applicable to the LH fuel tank and RH fuel tank. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-44-00/100 - COMPONENT LOCATION AMM MPP 28-00-00/200 - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES AMM TASK 12-11-01-600-802-A/300 FUEL-TANK PRESSURE DEFUELING - SERVICING AMM TASK 28-11-01-000-801-A/400 FUEL-TANK ACCESS PANELS - REMOVAL C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 531 531AB LH Underwing area 631 631AB RH Underwing area D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Fuel tanks I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A WARNING: BEFORE YOU DO THE TASK, OBEY THE SAFETY PRECAUTIONS GIVEN IN AMM MPP 28-00-00/200 TO PREVENT INJURY TO PERSONS AND DAMAGE TO MATERIAL. (1) Defuel the tanks ( AMM TASK 12-11-01-600-802-A/300). (2) On the circuit breaker panel, open these circuit breakers and attach a DO-NOT- CLOSE tag to them: EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 28-21-12 Page 2 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL • FUEL PUMPS 1A/1B/1C. • FUEL PUMPS 2A/2B/2C. • START 1/2. (3) Remove the access panels ( AMM MPP 06-44-00/100) and ( AMM TASK 28-11-01-000-801-A/400) shown below to get access to the motive-flow check valves: (a) LH fuel tank: • 531AB. (b) RH fuel tank: • 631AB. J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Loosen the nuts (2) and remove the motive-flow check valve (1). (2) Put applicable plugs or caps at all disconnected points to prevent contamination. (3) Remove the nipples (3) from the motive-flow check valve. (4) Discard the O-rings (4). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 28-21-12 Page 3 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ACFT WITH WET WINGSTUB Motive-Flow Check Valve - Removal/Installation Figure 401 B A ZONES 531 631 DET. A 2 2. NUT 2 3. NIPPLE 4. O-RING 4. O-RING 2 1. MOTIVE-FLOW 1 3. NIPPLE CHECK VALVE 2 2. NUT DET. B 1 DURING THE INSTALLATION OF THE VALVE, MAKE SURE THAT THE ARROW IS IN THE OUTBOARD DIRECTION 2 TORQUE: 26.0 N.m TO 29.4 N.m ( 230 TO 260 lb.in ) EM145AMM281614A.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 28-21-12 Page 4 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 28-21-12-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT WITH WET WINGSTUB 3. MOTIVE-FLOW CHECK VALVE - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task is applicable to the LH fuel tank and RH fuel tank. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-44-00/100 - COMPONENT LOCATION AMM MPP 28-00-00/200 - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES AMM TASK 12-11-01-600-801-A/300 FUEL-TANK PRESSURE REFUELING - SERVICING AMM TASK 28-11-01-400-801-A/400 FUEL-TANK ACCESS PANELS - INSTALLATION IPC 28-21-00 SUPPLY SYSTEM C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 531 531AB LH Underwing area 631 631AB RH Underwing area D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) Molykote DC-33 Light or equivalent Grease AR G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) O-ring IPC 28-21-00 2/LRU H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Fuel tanks EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 28-21-12 Page 5 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-003-A WARNING: BEFORE YOU DO THE TASK, OBEY THE SAFETY PRECAUTIONS GIVEN IN AMM MPP 28-00-00/200 TO PREVENT INJURY TO PERSONS AND DAMAGE TO MATERIAL. (1) Remove the protection caps or plugs from the disconnected points, if applicable. (2) Lubricate with Molykote DC-33 light grease and install the new O-rings (4) on the nipples (3). (3) Install the nipples (4) on the motive-flow check valve (1). J. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A CAUTION: • DURING THE INSTALLATION OF THE VALVE, MAKE SURE THAT THE ARROW IS IN THE OUTBOARD DIRECTION. • MAKE SURE THAT THE LINE FITTINGS ARE CLEAN TO PREVENT AN UNSATISFACTORY ELECTRICAL BONDING. (1) Install and tighten the nuts (2) to the motive-flow check valve (1). K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Install the access panels shown below ( AMM MPP 06-44-00/100) and ( AMM TASK 28-11-01-400-801-A/400): (a) LH fuel tank: • 531AB. (b) RH fuel tank: • 631AB. (2) Refuel the tanks ( AMM TASK 12-11-01-600-801-A/300) as applicable. (3) Examine for fuel leakage the access panels which were removed. Correct as necessary. (4) On the circuit breaker panel, close these circuit breakers and remove the DO-NOT- CLOSE tag from them: • FUEL PUMPS 1A/1B/1C. • FUEL PUMPS 2A/2B/2C. • START 1/2. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 28-21-12 Page 6 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

(2) On the circuit breaker panel, open these circuit breakers and attach a DO-NOT- CLOSE tag to them: EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 28-21-12 Page 7 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL • FUEL PUMPS 1A/1B/1C. • FUEL PUMPS 2A/2B/2C. • START 1/2. (3) Remove the access panels ( AMM MPP 06-44-00/100) and (AMM TASK 28-11-01-000-802-A/400) shown below to get access to the motive-flow check valves: (a) LH fuel tank: • 531AB. (b) RH fuel tank: • 631AB. J. Removal (Figure 402) SUBTASK 020-003-A (1) Loosen the nuts (2) and remove the motive-flow check valve (1). (2) Put applicable plugs or caps at all disconnected points to prevent contamination. (3) Remove the nipples (3) from the motive-flow check valve. (4) Discard the O-rings (4). O-RING 4. O-RING 1. MOTIVE-FLOW 2 1 3. NIPPLE CHECK VALVE 2 2. NUT DET. B 1 DURING THE INSTALLATION OF THE VALVE, MAKE SURE THAT THE ARROW IS IN THE OUTBOARD DIRECTION 2 TORQUE: 26.0 N.m TO 29.4 N.m ( 230 TO 260 lb.in ) 145AMM280207.MCE B EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 28-21-12 Page 9 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-005-A WARNING: BEFORE YOU DO THE TASK, OBEY THE SAFETY PRECAUTIONS GIVEN IN AMM MPP 28-00-00/200 TO PREVENT INJURY TO PERSONS AND DAMAGE TO MATERIAL. (1) Remove the protection caps or plugs from the disconnected points, if applicable. (2) Lubricate with Molykote DC-33 light grease and install the new O-rings (4) on the nipples (3). (3) Install the nipples (4) on the motive-flow check valve (1). J. Installation (Figure 402) SUBTASK 420-003-A CAUTION: • DURING THE INSTALLATION OF THE VALVE, MAKE SURE THAT THE ARROW IS IN THE OUTBOARD DIRECTION. • MAKE SURE THAT THE LINE FITTINGS ARE CLEAN TO PREVENT AN UNSATISFACTORY ELECTRICAL BONDING. (1) Install and tighten the nuts (2) to the motive-flow check valve (1). K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-003-A (1) Install the access panels shown below ( AMM MPP 06-44-00/100) and (AMM TASK 28-11-01-400-802-A/400): (a) LH fuel tank: • 531AB. (b) RH fuel tank: • 631AB. (2) Refuel the tanks ( AMM TASK 12-11-01-600-801-A/300) as applicable. (3) Examine for fuel leakage the access panels which were removed. Correct as necessary. (4) On the circuit breaker panel, close these circuit breakers and remove the DO-NOT- CLOSE tag from them: • FUEL PUMPS 1A/1B/1C. • FUEL PUMPS 2A/2B/2C. • START 1/2.
